meanings.definition: To assert or teach with authority or arrogance.
meanings.sent1: She dogmatised her opinions during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: He always dogmatises about the best way to cook pasta.
meanings.sent3: The cat dogmatised that it should be fed every hour.
meanings.sent4: The tree dogmatised its roots deep into the ground.
meanings.sent5: The teacher dogmatised the importance of studying for exams.

meanings.definition: To impose one's beliefs or opinions on others.
meanings.sent1: The politician dogmatised his views on the new law.
meanings.sent2: She often dogmatises her fashion choices on her friends.
meanings.sent3: The dog dogmatised that it should get the biggest bone.
meanings.sent4: The storm dogmatised its power over the small town.
meanings.sent5: The boss dogmatised his strict rules in the office.

meanings.definition: To adhere strictly to a particular doctrine or set of principles.
meanings.sent1: He dogmatised the rules of the game to the players.
meanings.sent2: She dogmatises the guidelines of the project to the team.
meanings.sent3: The robot dogmatised that it must follow its programming.
meanings.sent4: The river dogmatised its course through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The student dogmatised the importance of following the instructions.
